timeline.bodyText: Looks like this is from test period debug :)
timeline.author: dmvolod

timeline.bodyText: Use {} placeholders in logger and not + concat
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.bodyText: This forces the body to be string based. Wonder if we should in the future support inputstream and byte[] too
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.bodyText: Hmm I would rather have no surprise, and that we have a autoMethod=Basic you configure on the endpoint or component.
timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: not sure if i got this one right? this might be something i am missing. can you please give a little bit more details?
replies.author: onderson

replies.bodyText: You just assume username/password requires basic auth. But they may just be query parameters for something else. Instead we should have an option to turn on authentication first. And so only do this if that option is turned on.
replies.author: davsclaus

timeline.bodyText: Dont load classes via Class.forName. What is this proxyClassName use-case?
timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText:
i think it is to support proxy framework which is part of resteasy
https://docs.jboss.org/resteasy/docs/4.5.3.Final/userguide/html/RESTEasy_Client_Framework.html#proxies
replies.author: onderson

replies.bodyText: yes i am aware of the efforts of removing reflections and not sure this feature what to do about this feature, either removing or dropping might be fine as this is a feature in resteasy.
replies.author: onderson

replies.bodyText: So is this mandatory? Do I really need to write a class with annotations to call a remote HTTP REST service?
replies.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: in earlier versions the client framework was a bit limited in resteasy. there are other ways but looks like this is one of the prior methods considering API support coming from resteasy's history. to consider adding / removing such features, engagement with resteasy community might be good but can be said of being not strong ATM
replies.author: onderson

timeline.bodyText: Dont ignore exception, but log via logger or fail fast or something
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.bodyText: is it consumer only or was there also a producer?
timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: there is a producer. to be amended.
replies.author: onderson

timeline.bodyText:
This will read the entire stream into memory.
Camel has a stream caching feature. Maybe we should revisit this later.
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.bodyText: Can you avoid using this - Camel has api for working with exceptions. We should avoid adding a 3rd party JAR just to use a single api which we have ourselves or easily can write a few lines of code.
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.message: CAMEL-2933 - move some servlet classes to http-common and use registry interface and defaulthttpregistry from that dependency
CAMEL-15041 - rename options with more descriptive ones and regen
